intro: Inga sciadodendron, commonly known as the black inga, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense canopy, making it an important component of rainforest ecosystems. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a sweet scent to attract pollinators. The tree is also valued for its hard wood and is sometimes used in reforestation efforts due to its rapid growth.
